image.altText: Thomas Cooks

props.synopsis: The motives, opinions, affiliations and potential allies of the 20-year-old gunman responsible for the attempted assassination attempt of Donald Trump remain unknown, authorities say.

title.children: Trump rally shooter's motives remain unknown as investigators find explosive materials in car

image.altText: A map of a green field with three social media posts falling on it. The largest says "Looking more and more like an inside job"

props.synopsis: Falsehoods about former US president Donald Trump's attempted assassination are spreading online faster than journalists can assemble an accurate account of what we know. ABC News Verify has assembled the key claims, and how they have gained traction.

title.children: How politics, engagement bait and money opened up a firehose of falsehoods after Trump's shooting

image.altText: A face portrait of Clare O'Neil speaking and looking serious, hair down

props.synopsis: Home Affairs Minister Clare O'Neil has warned that democracy in Australia and overseas is under threat due to populism, misinformation and foreign interference.

title.children: Democracy is 'backsliding' and needs to adapt, Clare O'Neil warns

image.altText: An older man wearing a red tie, white shirt and a black suit jacket with a serious expression

props.synopsis: A US judge dismisses the criminal case accusing Donald Trump of illegally holding onto classified documents, dealing the former president another major legal victory as the Republican seeks a return to the White House.

title.children: Judge tosses Trump documents case, ruling prosecutor unlawfully appointed

image.altText: Joe Biden sitting at the resolute desk in the oval office

props.synopsis: In a rare televised address from the Oval Office, Joe Biden asks Americans to lower the political temperature and remember they are neighbours after a would-be assassin injures his Republican rival, Donald Trump.

title.children: Biden says American politics cannot be a 'killing field'

image.altText: Jay Slater smiles as he poses for a photo

props.synopsis: Spanish rescue teams in Tenerife find human remains in the area where British teenager Jay Slater went missing nearly a month ago, local police say.

title.children: Spanish rescuers find remains thought to be of missing British teenager Jay Slater

image.altText: Jacinta Allan stands at a lectern with microphones in front of her. Behind her is the Australian flag

props.synopsis: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has labelled alleged behaviour by the state's construction union as "thuggish and appalling".

title.children: Premier asks Labor to suspend CFMEU from Victorian party amid allegations of 'thuggish' behaviour

image.altText: A photo of a toddler with blonde hair and blue eyes looking into the camera.

props.synopsis: A man found guilty of the bashing murder of a toddler after moving in with the boy's mother has been jailed for 32 years.

title.children: Man jailed for 32 years over murder of ex-partner's toddler

image.altText: An aerial photograph of a police boat on the water

props.synopsis: Police say the homicide squad is investigating the death of a woman whose body was found in Melbourne's Maribyrnong River, but that the death of a man nearby does not seem related or suspicious.

title.children: Nothing to link deaths of man and woman found dead in Melbourne river, police say

image.altText: Novak Djokovic sits shirtless with his head down on a chair at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: Novak Djokovic has the history he has long craved, but in the months since he won a record 24th grand slam singles title, the sport and Carlos Alcaraz have passed him by.

title.children: Slumped, broken and beaten: The age of Djokovic is ending

image.altText: Man standing with two daughters either side with kitchen in background

props.synopsis: Greg Lacey and his family were foster carers for three years but the mounting pressure on carers felt all-consuming.

title.children: Financial stress pushing foster carers out of the system and forcing kids into residential care

image.altText: A young woman in a staw hat next to a man in sunglasses

props.synopsis: I went to the Trump rally in Pennsylvania to see his campaign in action. I can viscerally recall the moment I realised there was a live possibility I could be shot at any second in an open field.

title.children: We came for the spectacle of a Trump rally. We left frazzled and shell-shocked

image.altText: A man stands inside with his arms crossed, looking serious.

props.synopsis: Land lease communities, where retirees buy their home but rent the land, are booming, fuelled by a housing affordability crisis and an aging population. But some residents say they feel trapped in a "financial prison" and experts say a lack of legal protections leave some with few options for redress.

title.children: 'Once you're in, you can't get out': The gated villages leaving retirees feeling trapped

image.altText: Trump has his eyes closed with a bloody cheek as suited agents surround him

props.synopsis: Former president Donald Trump uses social media to thank wellwishers, saying: "It was God alone who prevented the unthinkable from happening."

title.children: 'We will fear not': Donald Trump says nation must remain 'defiant in the face of wickedness'

image.altText: King Charles and Queen Camilla standing for a photo. Charles is wearing a blue suit, Camilla is wearing a long blue dress

props.synopsis: The royals will also visit Samoa to attend the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting.

title.children: King Charles and Camilla confirm October visit to Australia

image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiling as an excited voter, a young woman, takes a selfie with him.

props.synopsis: After all the bleak headlines of the past couple of weeks, Albanese's cheery optimism may seem a little weird. But some in the government can't believe they're not "cooked".

title.children: 13 rate rises could be expected to 'cook' a government — but some Albanese insiders can't believe the polls

image.altText: Republican presidential candidate former President Donald Trump is surround by US Secret Service agents at a campaign rally.

props.synopsis: The attempted assassination of former US president Donald Trump has sent a chill through the Western democratic world — and reminded us all just how dangerous and febrile political polarisation can be.

title.children: The unfounded theories and misinformation after the Trump shooting will be where the danger lies

image.altText: People walk toward a bombed-out building past debris and a small fire

props.synopsis: The IDF says it was targeting Hamas operatives who were launching attacks near the school, while also claiming a separate strike killed a senior Hamas military leader.

title.children: Israeli air strike near United Nations-run Gaza school kills at least 15 people

image.altText: A man stands with a younger girl as both smile and hold a balloon shaped like 20

props.synopsis: Corey Comperatore, 50, is dead and two other men are in critical condition following the attempted assassination of Donald Trump.

title.children: Volunteer firefighter killed at Trump rally died shielding wife and daughter from gunfire

image.altText: Phoebe, Prue and Piper Halliwell sisters smize in a promo image for the Charmed TV series, cut out against a blue backdrop.

props.synopsis: Here's what you might have missed in entertainment news over the weekend, from the many tributes to Shannen Doherty, to Harry Styles taking to the stage with Stevie Nicks.

title.children: The late Shannen Doherty was a 'soft-hearted badass' and a 'force of nature', say fellow actors

image.altText: Gareth Southgate walks past a trophy and holds his mouth

props.synopsis: The purgatory of Gareth Southgate: The man who rescued England, yet seems damned to be subject to yet more of its repeated failures.

title.children: The man who rescued England doomed to oversee its continued failures

image.altText: Adam Scott plays a shot

props.synopsis: After seeming poised to win his PGA Tour title in four years, Adam Scott is stunned as the Scottish crowd spurs local favourite Robert MacIntyre to a famous victory.

title.children: Adam Scott's PGA Tour drought continues after hometown hero's remarkable Scottish Open heist

image.altText: Airplanes on a tarmac.

props.synopsis: There are calls for stronger protection for passengers. But some airlines say it won't improve outcomes for passengers, instead saying it could increase airfares.

title.children: Should airlines have to compensate domestic travellers when flights are cancelled or delayed?

image.altText: bt sentencing downing centre

props.synopsis: Abhijeet Kulkarni will spend up to eight years behind bars after posing as young girls to solicit child pornography from several teenage victims across Australia.

title.children: IT worker who led 'double life' posing as teenage girls online jailed for soliciting child porn

image.altText: A packet of flower seeds held in a hand outside a Bunnings hardware store.

props.synopsis: Major Australian nurseries, including retail giant Bunnings, are selling plants listed by governments and their own industry body as invasive weeds.

title.children: Bunnings under fire for selling plants that become 'a ticking time bomb'

image.altText: kate waving

props.synopsis: The Wimbledon crowd gives Catherine, the Princess of Wales, a standing ovation as she makes just her second public appearance since announcing her cancer diagnosis.

title.children: Kate Middleton receives standing ovation at Wimbledon

image.altText: Yakun Pei arranges tinned food on the shelf at the general store in Tibooburra.

props.synopsis: Reaching for canned and frozen fruit and vegetables can help keep costs down. We asked a cookery teacher about the most delicious ways to use them.

title.children: These frozen and canned food ideas are delicious and thrifty

image.altText: A man in a white shirt and with grey hair stands outside a football stadium.

props.synopsis: Legendary Australian commentator Bruce McAvaney OAM will headline the ABC's radio coverage of the 2024 Paris Olympic Games later this month.

title.children: Veteran sports commentator Bruce McAvaney picks up mic for Paris Olympics

image.altText: Travis Bazzana throws a baseball

props.synopsis: Sydney native Travis Bazzana has created history by becoming the first Australian player ever to be selected at the top of the MLB Draft after his name was called out by the Cleveland Guardians.

title.children: Aussie set to earn $15m payday after being selected first overall in MLB draft

image.altText: Tadej Pogacar celebrates at the Tour de France

props.synopsis: Tadej Pogačar shows why he is the man to beat at this year's Tour de France with a sensational climb during stage 15, a day after he was one of several riders to have chips thrown at them.

title.children: Pogačar maintains Tour lead after all-time climb as authorities act over 'disrespectful' potato chip incident

image.altText: Armed guards in suits and military uniforms watch a crowd as they crouch down

props.synopsis: Donald Trump was still receiving treatment from a failed assassination attempt when senior Republican politicians started demanding answers from the US Secret Service.

title.children: US Secret Service facing questions after Donald Trump assassination attempt

image.altText: Copy of AFLart

props.synopsis: Pull out the old ladder predictor again, because this weekend's results have turned 2024 on its head. Here's everything you need to know from the weekend's action.

title.children: AFL Round-Up: The Cats experiment that bodes well for the future, and Hawks champ hands a wake-up call to finals contenders

image.altText: On stage, Zahra Newman, in a wig and glasses, stands, hands in pockets. On a screen behind her is a video of her as Dracula.

props.synopsis: Sydney Theatre Company's award-winning Victorian gothic "cine-theatre" trilogy, combining live performance and video, has its final piece, with the premiere of a new adaptation of Bram Stoker's Dracula.

title.children: Why this new adaptation of Dracula starring one woman in 23 roles is about the 'monster within'

image.altText: Two headshots of young men side by side. Left has black hair and blue tshirt. Right has brown hair and green tshirt.

props.synopsis: For Logan and Jax, coming out as queer to supportive friends and family in their regional community changed everything. But not everyone is as lucky.

title.children: 'His acceptance changed everything': Why support matters when young people come out
